p: The average number of initial notification per year was 11 for the period 2009 to 2012 and 5 for the period 2013 to 2019. Considering that the decrease in notifications concerning safety issues was the major contributor to the drop in the overall number of initial notifications after 2012, it may be argued that the implementation of the revised pharmacovigilance legislation in 2012 introduced clear roles and responsibilities and offered robust regulatory tools to manage most of the incidents without recourse to the IRN mechanism.
